trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Recommendations API Documentation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Recommendations API Documentation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API documentation for a recommendations engine available in the Microsoft Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API documentation for a recommendations engine available in the Microsoft Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API Documentation
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API Documentation

trans-unit.source: This document depicts Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Recommendations APIs.
trans-unit.target: This document depicts Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Recommendations APIs.

trans-unit.source: This document is an API reference.
trans-unit.target: This document is an API reference.

trans-unit.source: You should start with the “Azure Machine Learning Recommendation – Quick Start” document.
trans-unit.target: You should start with the “Azure Machine Learning Recommendation – Quick Start” document.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API can be divided into the following logical groups:
trans-unit.target: The Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API can be divided into the following logical groups:

trans-unit.source: <ins>General Information</ins> - Information on authentication, service URI and versioning.
trans-unit.target: <ins>General Information</ins> - Information on authentication, service URI and versioning.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Model Basic</ins> – APIs that enable you to do the basic operations on model (e.g. create, update and delete a model).
trans-unit.target: <ins>Model Basic</ins> – APIs that enable you to do the basic operations on model (e.g. create, update and delete a model).

trans-unit.source: <ins>Model Advanced</ins> – APIs that enable you to get advanced data insights on the model.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Model Advanced</ins> – APIs that enable you to get advanced data insights on the model.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Model Business Rules</ins> – APIs that enable you to manage business rules on the model recommendation results.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Model Business Rules</ins> – APIs that enable you to manage business rules on the model recommendation results.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Catalog</ins> – APIs that enable you to do basic operations on a model catalog.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Catalog</ins> – APIs that enable you to do basic operations on a model catalog.

trans-unit.source: A catalog contains metadata information on the items of the usage data.
trans-unit.target: A catalog contains metadata information on the items of the usage data.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Feature</ins> - APIs that enable to get insights on item into the catalog and how to use this information to build better recommendations.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Feature</ins> - APIs that enable to get insights on item into the catalog and how to use this information to build better recommendations.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Usage Data</ins> – APIs that enable you to do basic operations on the model usage data. Usage data in t
trans-unit.target: <ins>Usage Data</ins> – APIs that enable you to do basic operations on the model usage data. Usage data in t

trans-unit.source: he basic form consists of rows that include pairs of <userId>,<itemId>.
trans-unit.target: he basic form consists of rows that include pairs of <userId>,<itemId>.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Build</ins> – APIs that enable you to trigger a model build and do basic operations that are related to this build.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Build</ins> – APIs that enable you to trigger a model build and do basic operations that are related to this build.

trans-unit.source: You can trigger a model build once you have valuable usage data.
trans-unit.target: You can trigger a model build once you have valuable usage data.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Recommendation</ins> – APIs that enable you to consume recommendations once the build of a model ends.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Recommendation</ins> – APIs that enable you to consume recommendations once the build of a model ends.

trans-unit.source: <ins>User Data</ins> - APIs that enable you to fetch information on the user usage data.
trans-unit.target: <ins>User Data</ins> - APIs that enable you to fetch information on the user usage data.

trans-unit.source: <ins>Notifications</ins> – APIs that enable you to receive notifications on problems related to your API operations.
trans-unit.target: <ins>Notifications</ins> – APIs that enable you to receive notifications on problems related to your API operations.

trans-unit.source: (For example, you are reporting usage data via Data Acquisition and most of the events processing are failing.
trans-unit.target: (For example, you are reporting usage data via Data Acquisition and most of the events processing are failing.

trans-unit.source: An error notification will be raised.)
trans-unit.target: An error notification will be raised.)

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of models per subscription is 10.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of models per subscription is 10.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of builds per model is 20.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of builds per model is 20.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of items that a catalog can hold is 100,000.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of items that a catalog can hold is 100,000.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of usage points that are kept is ~5,000,000.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of usage points that are kept is ~5,000,000.

trans-unit.source: The oldest will be deleted if new ones will be uploaded or reported.
trans-unit.target: The oldest will be deleted if new ones will be uploaded or reported.

trans-unit.source: The maximum size of data that can be sent in POST (e.g. import catalog data, import usage data) is 200MB.
trans-unit.target: The maximum size of data that can be sent in POST (e.g. import catalog data, import usage data) is 200MB.

trans-unit.source: The number of transactions per second for a recommendation model build that is not active is ~2TPS.
trans-unit.target: The number of transactions per second for a recommendation model build that is not active is ~2TPS.

trans-unit.source: A recommendation model build that is active can hold up to 20TPS.
trans-unit.target: A recommendation model build that is active can hold up to 20TPS.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of items that can be asked for when getting recommendations is 150.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of items that can be asked for when getting recommendations is 150.

trans-unit.source: Please follow the Microsoft Azure Marketplace guidelines regarding authentication.
trans-unit.target: Please follow the Microsoft Azure Marketplace guidelines regarding authentication.

trans-unit.source: The marketplace supports either the Basic or OAuth authentication method.
trans-unit.target: The marketplace supports either the Basic or OAuth authentication method.

trans-unit.source: Service URI The service root URI for the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations APIs is [here.](https://api.datamarket.azure.com/amla/recommendations/v3/)
trans-unit.target: Service URI The service root URI for the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations APIs is [here.](https://api.datamarket.azure.com/amla/recommendations/v3/)

trans-unit.source: The full service URI is expressed using elements of the OData specification.
trans-unit.target: The full service URI is expressed using elements of the OData specification.

trans-unit.source: Each API call will have, at the end, a query parameter called apiVersion that should be set to 1.0.
trans-unit.target: Each API call will have, at the end, a query parameter called apiVersion that should be set to 1.0.

trans-unit.source: IDs, returned by any of the APIs, are case sensitive and should be used as such when passed as parameters in subsequent API calls.
trans-unit.target: IDs, returned by any of the APIs, are case sensitive and should be used as such when passed as parameters in subsequent API calls.

trans-unit.source: For instance, model IDs and catalog IDs are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: For instance, model IDs and catalog IDs are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: Creating a recommendation model is usually enough to allow the system to provide recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Creating a recommendation model is usually enough to allow the system to provide recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Nevertheless, recommendation quality varies based on the usage processed and the coverage of the catalog.
trans-unit.target: Nevertheless, recommendation quality varies based on the usage processed and the coverage of the catalog.

trans-unit.source: For example if you have a lot of cold items (items without significant usage), the system will have difficulties providing a recommendation for such an item or using such an item as a recommended one.
trans-unit.target: For example if you have a lot of cold items (items without significant usage), the system will have difficulties providing a recommendation for such an item or using such an item as a recommended one.

trans-unit.source: In order to overcome the cold item problem, the system allows the use of metadata of the items to enhance the recommendations.
trans-unit.target: In order to overcome the cold item problem, the system allows the use of metadata of the items to enhance the recommendations.

trans-unit.source: This metadata is referred to as features.
trans-unit.target: This metadata is referred to as features.

trans-unit.source: Typical features are a book's author or a movie's actor.
trans-unit.target: Typical features are a book's author or a movie's actor.

trans-unit.source: Features are provided via the catalog in the form of key/value strings.
trans-unit.target: Features are provided via the catalog in the form of key/value strings.

trans-unit.source: For the full format of the catalog file, please refer to the [import catalog section](#81-import-catalog-data).
trans-unit.target: For the full format of the catalog file, please refer to the [import catalog section](#81-import-catalog-data).

trans-unit.source: Features can enhance the recommendation model, but to do so requires the use of meaningful features.
trans-unit.target: Features can enhance the recommendation model, but to do so requires the use of meaningful features.

trans-unit.source: For this purpose a new build was introduced - a rank build.
trans-unit.target: For this purpose a new build was introduced - a rank build.

trans-unit.source: This build will rank the usefulness of features.
trans-unit.target: This build will rank the usefulness of features.

trans-unit.source: A meaningful feature is a feature with a rank score of 2 and up.
trans-unit.target: A meaningful feature is a feature with a rank score of 2 and up.

trans-unit.source: After understanding which of the features are meaningful, trigger a recommendation build with the list (or sublist) of meaningful features.
trans-unit.target: After understanding which of the features are meaningful, trigger a recommendation build with the list (or sublist) of meaningful features.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to use these feature for the enhancement of both warm items and cold items.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to use these feature for the enhancement of both warm items and cold items.

trans-unit.source: In order to use them for warm items, the `UseFeatureInModel` build parameter should be set up.
trans-unit.target: In order to use them for warm items, the `UseFeatureInModel` build parameter should be set up.

trans-unit.source: In order to use features for cold items, the `AllowColdItemPlacement` build parameter should be enabled.
trans-unit.target: In order to use features for cold items, the `AllowColdItemPlacement` build parameter should be enabled.

trans-unit.source: Note: It is not possible to enable `AllowColdItemPlacement` without enabling `UseFeatureInModel`.
trans-unit.target: Note: It is not possible to enable `AllowColdItemPlacement` without enabling `UseFeatureInModel`.

trans-unit.source: Recommendation reasoning is another aspect of feature usage.
trans-unit.target: Recommendation reasoning is another aspect of feature usage.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations engine can use features to provide recommendation explanations (a.k.a.
trans-unit.target: Indeed, the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations engine can use features to provide recommendation explanations (a.k.a.

trans-unit.source: reasoning), leading to more confidence in the recommended item from the recommendation consumer.
trans-unit.target: reasoning), leading to more confidence in the recommended item from the recommendation consumer.

trans-unit.source: To enable reasoning, the `AllowFeatureCorrelation` and `ReasoningFeatureList` parameters should be setup prior to requesting a recommendation build.
trans-unit.target: To enable reasoning, the `AllowFeatureCorrelation` and `ReasoningFeatureList` parameters should be setup prior to requesting a recommendation build.

trans-unit.source: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.

trans-unit.source:
You can update the model description or the active build ID.
Active build ID – Every build for every model has a build ID.
trans-unit.target:
You can update the model description or the active build ID.
Active build ID – Every build for every model has a build ID.

trans-unit.source: The active build ID is the first successful build of every new model.
trans-unit.target: The active build ID is the first successful build of every new model.

trans-unit.source: Once you have an active build ID and you do additional builds for the same model, you need to explicitly set it as the default build ID if you want to.
trans-unit.target: Once you have an active build ID and you do additional builds for the same model, you need to explicitly set it as the default build ID if you want to.

trans-unit.source:
When you consume recommendations, if you do not specify the build ID that you want to use, the default one will be used automatically.
This mechanism enables you - once you have a recommendation model in production - to build new models and test them before you promote them to production.
trans-unit.target:
When you consume recommendations, if you do not specify the build ID that you want to use, the default one will be used automatically.
This mechanism enables you - once you have a recommendation model in production - to build new models and test them before you promote them to production.

trans-unit.source: These are the types of rules supported:
trans-unit.target: These are the types of rules supported:

trans-unit.source: BlockList - BlockList enables you to provide a list of items that you do not want to return in the recommendation results.
trans-unit.target: BlockList - BlockList enables you to provide a list of items that you do not want to return in the recommendation results.

trans-unit.source: FeatureBlockList - Feature BlockList enables you to block items based on the values of its features.
trans-unit.target: FeatureBlockList - Feature BlockList enables you to block items based on the values of its features.

trans-unit.source: *Do not send more than 1000 items in a single blocklist rule or your call may timeout. If you need to block more than 1000 items, you can make several blocklist calls.*
trans-unit.target: *Do not send more than 1000 items in a single blocklist rule or your call may timeout. If you need to block more than 1000 items, you can make several blocklist calls.*

trans-unit.source: Upsale - Upsale enables you to enforce items to return in the recommendation results.
trans-unit.target: Upsale - Upsale enables you to enforce items to return in the recommendation results.

trans-unit.source: WhiteList - White List enables you to only suggest recommendations from a list of items.
trans-unit.target: WhiteList - White List enables you to only suggest recommendations from a list of items.

trans-unit.source: FeatureWhiteList - Feature White List enables you to only recommend items that have specific feature values.
trans-unit.target: FeatureWhiteList - Feature White List enables you to only recommend items that have specific feature values.

trans-unit.source: PerSeedBlockList - Per Seed Block List enables you to provide per item a list of items that cannot be returned as recommendation results.
trans-unit.target: PerSeedBlockList - Per Seed Block List enables you to provide per item a list of items that cannot be returned as recommendation results.

trans-unit.source:
Whenever providing Item Ids for business rules, make sure to use the External Id of the item (the same Id that you used in the catalog file)
To add a BlockList rule:
`24024f7e-b45c-419e-bfa2-dfd947e0d253BlockList{"ItemsToExclude":["2406E770-769C-4189-89DE-1C9283F93A96","3906E110-769C-4189-89DE-1C9283F98888"]}`

To add a FeatureBlockList rule:

`24024f7e-b45c-419e-bfa2-dfd947e0d253FeatureBlockList{"Name":"Movie_category","Values":["Adult","Drama"]}`

To add an Upsale rule:
`24024f7e-b45c-419e-bfa2-dfd947e0d253Upsale{"ItemsToUpsale":["2406E770-769C-4189-89DE-1C9283F93A96"]}`

To add a WhiteList rule:
`24024f7e-b45c-419e-bfa2-dfd947e0d253WhiteList{"ItemsToInclude":["2406E770-769C-4189-89DE-1C9283F93A96","1116E770-769C-4189-89DE-1C9283F88888"]}`

To add a FeatureWhiteList rule:

`24024f7e-b45c-419e-bfa2-dfd947e0d253FeatureWhiteList{"Name":"Movie_rating","Values":["PG13"]}`

To add a PerSeedBlockList rule:
`24024f7e-b45c-419e-bfa2-dfd947e0d253PerSeedBlockList{"SeedItems":["9949"],"ItemsToExclude":["9862","8158","8244"]}`|
trans-unit.target:

trans-unit.source: The API returns the newly created rule with its details.
trans-unit.target: The API returns the newly created rule with its details.

trans-unit.source: The rules property can be retrieved from the following paths:
trans-unit.target: The rules property can be retrieved from the following paths:

trans-unit.source: `feed/entry/content/properties/Type` – Type of the rule: BlockList or Upsale.
trans-unit.target: `feed/entry/content/properties/Type` – Type of the rule: BlockList or Upsale.

trans-unit.source: If you upload several catalog files to the same model with several calls, we will insert only the new catalog items.
trans-unit.target: If you upload several catalog files to the same model with several calls, we will insert only the new catalog items.

trans-unit.source: Existing items will remain with the original values.
trans-unit.target: Existing items will remain with the original values.

trans-unit.source: You cannot update catalog data by using this method.
trans-unit.target: You cannot update catalog data by using this method.

trans-unit.source: The catalog data should follow the following format:
trans-unit.target: The catalog data should follow the following format:

trans-unit.source: With features - `<Item Id>,<Item Name>,<Item Category>,[<Description>],<Features list>`
trans-unit.target: With features - `<Item Id>,<Item Name>,<Item Category>,[<Description>],<Features list>`

trans-unit.source: Note: The maximum file size is 200MB.
trans-unit.target: Note: The maximum file size is 200MB.

trans-unit.source: Category to which this item belongs (e.g. Cooking Books, Drama…); can be empty.
trans-unit.target: Category to which this item belongs (e.g. Cooking Books, Drama…); can be empty.

trans-unit.source: No, unless features are present (but can be empty)
trans-unit.target: No, unless features are present (but can be empty)

trans-unit.source: Max length: 4000; Max number of features:20
trans-unit.target: Max length: 4000; Max number of features:20

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated list of feature name=feature value that can be used to enhance model recommendation; see [Advanced topics](#2-advanced-topics) section.
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated list of feature name=feature value that can be used to enhance model recommendation; see [Advanced topics](#2-advanced-topics) section.

trans-unit.source: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to upload usage data by using a file.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to upload usage data by using a file.

trans-unit.source: You can call this API several times with usage data.
trans-unit.target: You can call this API several times with usage data.

trans-unit.source: All usage data will be saved for all calls.
trans-unit.target: All usage data will be saved for all calls.

trans-unit.source: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Only letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9), hyphens (-) and underscore (_) are allowed.

trans-unit.source:
Format:
`,[,,]`

NameMandatoryTypeDescription
User IdYes[A-z], [a-z], [0-9], [_] (Underscore), [-] (Dash)
Max length: 255 		Unique identifier of a user.
Item IdYes[A-z], [a-z], [0-9], [_] (Underscore), [-] (Dash)
Max length: 50		Unique identifier of an item.
TimeNoDate in format: YYYY/MM/DDTHH:MM:SS (e.g. 2013/06/20T10:00:00)Time of data.
EventNo; if supplied then must also put dateOne of the following:
• Click
• RecommendationClick
• AddShopCart
• RemoveShopCart
• Purchase

Maximum file size: 200MB

149452,1b3d95e2-84e4-414c-bb38-be9cf461c347

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to send events in real time to Azure Machine Learning Recommendations, usually from your website.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to send events in real time to Azure Machine Learning Recommendations, usually from your website.

trans-unit.source: Event data entry for each event you want to send.
trans-unit.target: Event data entry for each event you want to send.

trans-unit.source: You should send for the same user or browser session the same ID in the SessionId field.
trans-unit.target: You should send for the same user or browser session the same ID in the SessionId field.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves metadata of all model usage files.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves metadata of all model usage files.

trans-unit.source: The response includes one entry per usage file.
trans-unit.target: The response includes one entry per usage file.

trans-unit.source: Each entry has the following data:
trans-unit.target: Each entry has the following data:

trans-unit.source: `feed\entry\content\properties\DateModified` – Date when the usage file was created.
trans-unit.target: `feed\entry\content\properties\DateModified` – Date when the usage file was created.

trans-unit.source: `feed\entry\content\properties\UseInModel` – Whether the usage file is used in the model.
trans-unit.target: `feed\entry\content\properties\UseInModel` – Whether the usage file is used in the model.

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated string of event types or null to get all events
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated string of event types or null to get all events

trans-unit.source: Each one contains the sum of events for a specific event type grouped by hour.
trans-unit.target: Each one contains the sum of events for a specific event type grouped by hour.

trans-unit.source: `feed\entry[i]\content\properties\Key` – Contains the time (grouped by hour) and the event type.
trans-unit.target: `feed\entry[i]\content\properties\Key` – Contains the time (grouped by hour) and the event type.

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to retrieve feature information, such as the imported features and their values, their rank, and when this rank was allocated.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to retrieve feature information, such as the imported features and their values, their rank, and when this rank was allocated.

trans-unit.source: Features are imported as part of the catalog data, and then their rank is associated when a rank build is done.
trans-unit.target: Features are imported as part of the catalog data, and then their rank is associated when a rank build is done.

trans-unit.source: Feature rank can change according to the pattern of usage data and type of items.
trans-unit.target: Feature rank can change according to the pattern of usage data and type of items.

trans-unit.source: But for consistent usage/items, the rank should have only small fluctuations.
trans-unit.target: But for consistent usage/items, the rank should have only small fluctuations.

trans-unit.source: The rank of features is a non-negative number.
trans-unit.target: The rank of features is a non-negative number.

trans-unit.source: The number 0 means that the feature was not ranked (happens if you invoke this API prior to the completion of the first rank build).
trans-unit.target: The number 0 means that the feature was not ranked (happens if you invoke this API prior to the completion of the first rank build).

trans-unit.source: The date at which the rank was attributed is called the score freshness.
trans-unit.target: The date at which the rank was attributed is called the score freshness.

trans-unit.source: Get Features Info (For Last Rank Build)
trans-unit.target: Get Features Info (For Last Rank Build)

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the feature information, including ranking, for the last successful rank build.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the feature information, including ranking, for the last successful rank build.

trans-unit.source: Number of values to include for each feature according to the data present in the catalog.
trans-unit.target: Number of values to include for each feature according to the data present in the catalog.

trans-unit.source: N - Return N samples for each feature name.
trans-unit.target: N - Return N samples for each feature name.

trans-unit.source: The response contains a list of feature info entries.
trans-unit.target: The response contains a list of feature info entries.

trans-unit.source: `feed/entry/content/m:properties/d:RankUpdateDate` - Date at which the rank was allocated to this feature, a.k.a.
trans-unit.target: `feed/entry/content/m:properties/d:RankUpdateDate` - Date at which the rank was allocated to this feature, a.k.a.

trans-unit.source: A historical date ('0001-01-01T00:00:00') means that no rank build was performed.
trans-unit.target: A historical date ('0001-01-01T00:00:00') means that no rank build was performed.

trans-unit.source: A rank of 2.0 and up is considered a good feature.
trans-unit.target: A rank of 2.0 and up is considered a good feature.

trans-unit.source: `feed/entry/content/m:properties/d:SampleValues` - Comma-separated list of values up to the sampling size requested.
trans-unit.target: `feed/entry/content/m:properties/d:SampleValues` - Comma-separated list of values up to the sampling size requested.

trans-unit.target: Get Features Info (For Specific Rank Build)

trans-unit.target: Retrieves the feature information, including the ranking for a specific rank build.

trans-unit.source: Number of values to include for each feature according to the data present in the catalog.
trans-unit.target: Number of values to include for each feature according to the data present in the catalog.

trans-unit.source: N - Return N samples for each feature name.
trans-unit.target: N - Return N samples for each feature name.

trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the rank build or -1 for the last rank build

trans-unit.target: The response contains a list of feature info entries.

trans-unit.target: `feed/entry/content/m:properties/d:RankUpdateDate` - Date at which the rank was allocated to this feature, a.k.a.

trans-unit.target: A historical date ('0001-01-01T00:00:00') means that no rank build was performed.

trans-unit.source: This section explains the different APIs related to builds.
trans-unit.target: This section explains the different APIs related to builds.

trans-unit.source: There are 3 types of builds: a recommendation build, a rank build and an FBT (frequently bought together) build.
trans-unit.target: There are 3 types of builds: a recommendation build, a rank build and an FBT (frequently bought together) build.

trans-unit.source: The recommendation build's purpose is to generate a recommendation model used for predictions.
trans-unit.target: The recommendation build's purpose is to generate a recommendation model used for predictions.

trans-unit.source: Predictions (for this type of build) come in two flavors:
trans-unit.target: Predictions (for this type of build) come in two flavors:

trans-unit.source: Item to Item recommendations - given an item or a list of items this option will predict a list of items that are likely to be of high interest.
trans-unit.target: Item to Item recommendations - given an item or a list of items this option will predict a list of items that are likely to be of high interest.

trans-unit.source: User to Item recommendations - given a user id (and optionally a list of items) this option will predict a list of items that are likely to be of high interest for the given user (and its additional choice of items).
trans-unit.target: User to Item recommendations - given a user id (and optionally a list of items) this option will predict a list of items that are likely to be of high interest for the given user (and its additional choice of items).

trans-unit.source: The U2I recommendations are based on the history of items that were of interest for the user up to the time the model was built.
trans-unit.target: The U2I recommendations are based on the history of items that were of interest for the user up to the time the model was built.

trans-unit.source: A rank build is a technical build that allows you to learn about the usefulness of your features.
trans-unit.target: A rank build is a technical build that allows you to learn about the usefulness of your features.

trans-unit.source: Usually, in order to get the best result for a recommendation model involving features, you should take the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Usually, in order to get the best result for a recommendation model involving features, you should take the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Trigger a rank build (unless the score of your features is stable) and wait till you get the feature score.
trans-unit.target: Trigger a rank build (unless the score of your features is stable) and wait till you get the feature score.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the rank of your features by calling the [Get Features Info](#101-get-features-info-for-last-rank-build) API.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the rank of your features by calling the [Get Features Info](#101-get-features-info-for-last-rank-build) API.

trans-unit.source: Configure a recommendation build with the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Configure a recommendation build with the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: `ModelingFeatureList` - Set to a comma-separated list of features with a score of 2.0 or more (according to the ranks you retrieved in the previous step).
trans-unit.target: `ModelingFeatureList` - Set to a comma-separated list of features with a score of 2.0 or more (according to the ranks you retrieved in the previous step).

trans-unit.source: Optionally you can set `EnableFeatureCorrelation` to True and `ReasoningFeatureList` to the list of features you want to use for explanations (usually the same list of features used in modelling or a sublist).
trans-unit.target: Optionally you can set `EnableFeatureCorrelation` to True and `ReasoningFeatureList` to the list of features you want to use for explanations (usually the same list of features used in modelling or a sublist).

trans-unit.source: Trigger the recommendation build with the configured parameters.
trans-unit.target: Trigger the recommendation build with the configured parameters.

trans-unit.source: Note: If you do not configure any parameters (e.g. invoke the recommendation build without parameters) or you do not explicitly disable the usage of features (e.g. `UseFeatureInModel` set to False), the system will set up the feature-related parameters to the explained values above in case a rank build exists.
trans-unit.target: Note: If you do not configure any parameters (e.g. invoke the recommendation build without parameters) or you do not explicitly disable the usage of features (e.g. `UseFeatureInModel` set to False), the system will set up the feature-related parameters to the explained values above in case a rank build exists.

trans-unit.source: There is no restriction on running a rank build and a recommendation build concurrently for the same model.
trans-unit.target: There is no restriction on running a rank build and a recommendation build concurrently for the same model.

trans-unit.source: Nevertheless, you cannot run two builds of the same type on the same model in parallel.
trans-unit.target: Nevertheless, you cannot run two builds of the same type on the same model in parallel.

trans-unit.source: An FBT (Frequently bought together) build is yet another recommendations algorithm called sometimes "conservative" recommender, which is good for catalogs that are not homogeneous in nature (homogeneous: books, movies, some food, fashion; non-homogeneous: computer and devices, cross-domain, highly diverse).
trans-unit.target: An FBT (Frequently bought together) build is yet another recommendations algorithm called sometimes "conservative" recommender, which is good for catalogs that are not homogeneous in nature (homogeneous: books, movies, some food, fashion; non-homogeneous: computer and devices, cross-domain, highly diverse).

trans-unit.source: Note: if the usage files that you uploaded contain the optional field "event type" then for FBT modelling only "Purchase" events will be used.
trans-unit.target: Note: if the usage files that you uploaded contain the optional field "event type" then for FBT modelling only "Purchase" events will be used.

trans-unit.source: If no event type is provided all events will be considered as purchase.
trans-unit.target: If no event type is provided all events will be considered as purchase.

trans-unit.source: Each build type can be configured via a set of parameters (depicted below).
trans-unit.target: Each build type can be configured via a set of parameters (depicted below).

trans-unit.source: If you don't configure the parameters, the system will automatically attribute values to the parameters according to the information present at the time you trigger a build.
trans-unit.target: If you don't configure the parameters, the system will automatically attribute values to the parameters according to the information present at the time you trigger a build.

trans-unit.source: Users or items with few usage points might contain more noise than information.
trans-unit.target: Users or items with few usage points might contain more noise than information.

trans-unit.source: The system attempts to predict the minimal number of usage points per user/item to be used in a model.
trans-unit.target: The system attempts to predict the minimal number of usage points per user/item to be used in a model.

trans-unit.source: This number will be within the range defined by the ItemCutoffLowerBound and ItemCutoffUpperBound parameters for items, and the range defined by the UserCutOffLowerBound and UserCutoffUpperBound parameters for users.
trans-unit.target: This number will be within the range defined by the ItemCutoffLowerBound and ItemCutoffUpperBound parameters for items, and the range defined by the UserCutOffLowerBound and UserCutoffUpperBound parameters for users.

trans-unit.source: The condenser effect on items or users can be minimized by setting at least one of the corresponding bounds to zero.
trans-unit.target: The condenser effect on items or users can be minimized by setting at least one of the corresponding bounds to zero.

trans-unit.source: The table below depicts the build parameters for a rank build.
trans-unit.target: The table below depicts the build parameters for a rank build.

trans-unit.source: The number of iterations the model performs is reflected by the overall compute time and the model accuracy.
trans-unit.target: The number of iterations the model performs is reflected by the overall compute time and the model accuracy.

trans-unit.source: The higher the number, the better accuracy you will get, but the compute time will take longer.
trans-unit.target: The higher the number, the better accuracy you will get, but the compute time will take longer.

trans-unit.source: The number of dimensions relates to the number of 'features' the model will try to find within your data.
trans-unit.target: The number of dimensions relates to the number of 'features' the model will try to find within your data.

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of dimensions will allow better fine-tuning of the results into smaller clusters.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the number of dimensions will allow better fine-tuning of the results into smaller clusters.

trans-unit.source: However, too many dimensions will prevent the model from finding correlations between items.
trans-unit.target: However, too many dimensions will prevent the model from finding correlations between items.

trans-unit.source: Defines the item lower bound for the condenser.
trans-unit.target: Defines the item lower bound for the condenser.

trans-unit.source: Defines the item upper bound for the condenser.
trans-unit.target: Defines the item upper bound for the condenser.

trans-unit.source: Defines the user lower bound for the condenser.
trans-unit.target: Defines the user lower bound for the condenser.

trans-unit.source: Defines the user upper bound for the condenser.
trans-unit.target: Defines the user upper bound for the condenser.

trans-unit.target: The table below depicts the build parameters for recommendation build.

trans-unit.source: Allows you to compute metrics on the recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: Allows you to compute metrics on the recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if features can be used in order to enhance the recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if features can be used in order to enhance the recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated list of feature names to be used in the recommendation build, in order to enhance the recommendation.
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated list of feature names to be used in the recommendation build, in order to enhance the recommendation.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the recommendation should also push cold items via feature similarity.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the recommendation should also push cold items via feature similarity.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if features can be used in reasoning.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if features can be used in reasoning.

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated list of feature names to be used for reasoning sentences (e.g. recommendation explanations).
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated list of feature names to be used for reasoning sentences (e.g. recommendation explanations).

trans-unit.source: The table below depicts the build parameters for recommendation build.
trans-unit.target: The table below depicts the build parameters for recommendation build.

trans-unit.source: Number of co-occurrences of items to be considered for modeling.
trans-unit.target: Number of co-occurrences of items to be considered for modeling.

trans-unit.source: Bounds the number of items in a frequent set.
trans-unit.target: Bounds the number of items in a frequent set.

trans-unit.source: Minimal score that a frequent set should have in order to be included in the returned results.
trans-unit.target: Minimal score that a frequent set should have in order to be included in the returned results.

trans-unit.source: Defines the similarity function to be used by the build.
trans-unit.target: Defines the similarity function to be used by the build.

trans-unit.source: Lift favors serendipity, Co-occurrence favors predictability, and Jaccard is a nice compromise between the two.
trans-unit.target: Lift favors serendipity, Co-occurrence favors predictability, and Jaccard is a nice compromise between the two.

trans-unit.source: By default this API will trigger a recommendation model build.
trans-unit.target: By default this API will trigger a recommendation model build.

trans-unit.source: To trigger a rank build (in order to score features), the build API variant with build type parameter should be used.
trans-unit.target: To trigger a rank build (in order to score features), the build API variant with build type parameter should be used.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you use spaces you must encode it with %20 instead.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you use spaces you must encode it with %20 instead.

trans-unit.source:
If left empty then the build will be executed with the default build parameters.

If you want to set the build parameters, send the parameters as XML into the body as in the following sample.
trans-unit.target:
If left empty then the build will be executed with the default build parameters.

If you want to set the build parameters, send the parameters as XML into the body as in the following sample.

trans-unit.source: (See the "Build parameters" section for an explanation of the parameters.)`<NumberOfModelIterations>40</NumberOfModelIterations><NumberOfModelDimensions>20</NumberOfModelDimensions><MinItemAppearance>5</MinItemAppearance><MinUserAppearance>5</MinUserAppearance><EnableModelingInsights>true</EnableModelingInsights><UseFeaturesInModel>false</UseFeaturesInModel><ModelingFeatureList>feature_name_1,feature_name_2,...</ModelingFeatureList><AllowColdItemPlacement>false</AllowColdItemPlacement><EnableFeatureCorrelation>false</EnableFeatureCorrelation><ReasoningFeatureList>feature_name_a,feature_name_b,...</ReasoningFeatureList></BuildParametersList>`
trans-unit.target: (See the "Build parameters" section for an explanation of the parameters.)`<NumberOfModelIterations>40</NumberOfModelIterations><NumberOfModelDimensions>20</NumberOfModelDimensions><MinItemAppearance>5</MinItemAppearance><MinUserAppearance>5</MinUserAppearance><EnableModelingInsights>true</EnableModelingInsights><UseFeaturesInModel>false</UseFeaturesInModel><ModelingFeatureList>feature_name_1,feature_name_2,...</ModelingFeatureList><AllowColdItemPlacement>false</AllowColdItemPlacement><EnableFeatureCorrelation>false</EnableFeatureCorrelation><ReasoningFeatureList>feature_name_a,feature_name_b,...</ReasoningFeatureList></BuildParametersList>`

trans-unit.source: You will get a build ID as a response.
trans-unit.target: You will get a build ID as a response.

trans-unit.source: To know when the build has ended, you should call the “Get Builds Status of a Model” API and locate this build ID in the response.
trans-unit.target: To know when the build has ended, you should call the “Get Builds Status of a Model” API and locate this build ID in the response.

trans-unit.source: Note that a build can take from minutes to hours depending on the size of the data.
trans-unit.target: Note that a build can take from minutes to hours depending on the size of the data.

trans-unit.source: You cannot consume recommendations till the build ends.
trans-unit.target: You cannot consume recommendations till the build ends.

trans-unit.source: Queued – Build request was sent and it is queued.
trans-unit.target: Queued – Build request was sent and it is queued.

trans-unit.source: Error – Build ended with a failure.
trans-unit.target: Error – Build ended with a failure.

trans-unit.source: Cancelling – A cancel request for the build was sent.
trans-unit.target: Cancelling – A cancel request for the build was sent.

trans-unit.source: Note that the build ID can be found under the following path: `Feed\entry\content\properties\Id`
trans-unit.target: Note that the build ID can be found under the following path: `Feed\entry\content\properties\Id`

trans-unit.source: Note that if you use spaces you must encode it with %20 instead.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you use spaces you must encode it with %20 instead.

trans-unit.source: Type of the build to invoke:
trans-unit.target: Type of the build to invoke:

trans-unit.source:
If left empty then the build will be executed with the default build parameters.

If you want to set build parameters, send them as XML into the body like in the following sample.

If left empty then the build will be executed with the default build parameters.

If you want to set build parameters, send them as XML into the body like in the following sample.

trans-unit.source: The number of dimensions relates to the number of 'features' the model will try to find within your data.

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of dimensions will allow better fine-tuning of the results into smaller clusters.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations creates notifications when persistent errors happen in the system.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Recommendations creates notifications when persistent errors happen in the system.

trans-unit.source: Build failure - This notification is triggered for every build failure.
trans-unit.target: Build failure - This notification is triggered for every build failure.

trans-unit.source: Data acquisition processing failure - This notification is triggered when we have more than 100 errors in the last 5 minutes in the processing of usage events per model.
trans-unit.target: Data acquisition processing failure - This notification is triggered when we have more than 100 errors in the last 5 minutes in the processing of usage events per model.

trans-unit.source: Recommendation consumption failure - This notification is triggered when we have more than 100 errors in the last 5 minutes in the processing of recommendation requests per model.
trans-unit.target: Recommendation consumption failure - This notification is triggered when we have more than 100 errors in the last 5 minutes in the processing of recommendation requests per model.
